text: Koknese () is a town in middle Latvia. It is in Aizkraukle District. As of 2022, Koknese had a population of 2,562 people.Latvian Geospatial Information Agency Koknese is on rivers Pērse and Daugava. Koknese was a castle and river harbor at Middle Ages.Little Latvian Encyclopedia, 1967 It has town rights at 1277 until 17th century. Town rights were given again in 2021. == Roads == Roads from Koknese: Riga—Daugavpils (A6), Tīnūži—Koknese (P6), Ērgļi—Koknese (P79), Ogre—Koknese (V996), Suntaži—Koknese (V920). Koknese is railway station on line Riga—Daugavpils. The centre of district Aizkraukle is 14 km to east from Koknese. The capital city Riga is 100 km to west. == Gallery == Kokneses stacija.jpg|Railway station. Kokneses luterāņu baznīca 2000-07-23.jpg|Lutheran church. title: Koknese
